errors.error_description: The command for installing a specific package version uses a single equals sign (`=`) instead of the correct double equals sign (`==`), which will cause the command to fail.
correction_candidates: To install a specific version of a package, use: `pip install numpy==1.21.0`
To install a specific version of a package, use: `pip install 'numpy=1.21.0'`
To install a specific version of a package, use: `pip install numpy~=1.21.0`
To install a specific version of a package, use: `pip install numpy --version 1.21.0`
errors.golden_answer: To install a specific version of a package, use: `pip install numpy==1.21.0`

errors.error_description: The 'Installation from Source' instructions are incomplete. They omit the necessary first step of downloading the source code and suggest using a deprecated command (`python setup.py install`).
correction_candidates: First, clone the repository (`git clone https://github.com/pypa/pip.git`), `cd` into the directory, then run `pip install .`
First, download the source zip file from GitHub, unzip it, then run `python get-pip.py`.
To install from source, run `pip install git+https://github.com/pypa/pip.git`.
First, clone the repository, then run `python setup.py develop`.
